rationale: No intensifier or comparative directly modifies a risk-adjective.
statement_text: China has reported 21 human infections with the H5N6 subtype of avian influenza in 2021 to the World Health Organization, compared with only five last year, it [China] said, with six dead and many of the others critically ill.

rationale: The segment reports numbers and severity factually. 'critically ill' is a factual descriptor.
statement_text: China has reported 21 human infections with the H5N6 subtype of avian influenza in 2021 to the World Health Organization, compared with only five last year, it [China] said, with six dead and many of the others critically ill.

rationale: 'reported' is not a moderate verb. Scale is present but paired with 'reported' or outcome descriptions.
statement_text: China has reported 21 human infections with the H5N6 subtype of avian influenza in 2021 to the World Health Organization, compared with only five last year, it [China] said, with six dead and many of the others critically ill.

rationale: The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
statement_text: China has reported 21 human infections with the H5N6 subtype of avian influenza in 2021 to the World Health Organization, compared with only five last year, it [China] said, with six dead and many of the others critically ill.

rationale: The segment reports human infections, deaths, and critical illness, which is not calming.

rationale: 'compared with only five last year' uses a minimiser ('only') with an explicit scale contrast ('five' compared to '21 human infections').
